tafsirQuiz.question: Which concept is emphasized in Surah Al-Mujadilah, Ayah 2?
tafsirQuiz.correctAnswer: This was an old pagan custom which was known as zihar, by which one’s wife could be wrongfully divorced. Saying to one’s wife, ‘To me you are like my mother’s back’
distractors: This verse narrates a historical event
This verse gives rulings on trade and commerce
This verse promises paradise to the righteous

tafsirQuiz.question: What insight does the explanation provide about this ayah?
tafsirQuiz.correctAnswer: Any such action is absurd, because it cannot change the laws of nature. However, it has been made compulsory for the concerned person to pay a penalty and then go back to his wife
distractors: This verse addresses only legal rulings
This verse focuses on scientific facts
This verse is primarily about historical events

tafsirQuiz.question: What consequence is described in this ayah?
tafsirQuiz.correctAnswer: To oppose the Truth is to oppose God, and to oppose God means opposing that Being by opposing whom a man harms himself. Man can never hide anything from God, nor is it possible for anybody to elude His grasp
distractors: This verse explains the rules of inheritance
This verse talks about the stories of previous prophets
This verse describes the characteristics of believers

tafsirQuiz.question: What does this verse warn or promise?
tafsirQuiz.correctAnswer: They forget that at that very moment the whole of God’s creation will acclaim the truthful person, while they, with their narrow mentality, will have exhausted every last word of contempt and rejection
distractors: This verse talks about the stories of previous prophets
This verse discusses the creation of the universe
This verse explains the rules of inheritance

tafsirQuiz.question: What warning or glad tiding is mentioned in Surah Al-Mujadilah, Ayah 9?
tafsirQuiz.correctAnswer: If it is done with good intentions, it is legitimate but if it is done with evil intentions, it is sinful. However, sometimes for some good reason, secret whispering has to be resorted to
distractors: This verse describes the characteristics of believers
This verse explains the rules of inheritance
This verse talks about the stories of previous prophets

tafsirQuiz.question: What deeper meaning is explained in this verse?
tafsirQuiz.correctAnswer: To make such things a prestige issue is a sign of petty-mindedness: one who avoids doing so proves that, with regard to religious awareness, he has reached an elevated plane
distractors: This verse only discusses worldly matters
This verse is primarily about historical events
This verse addresses only legal rulings

tafsirQuiz.question: What does this verse warn or promise?
tafsirQuiz.correctAnswer: These injuctions were originally intended to apply to the Prophet, but even after the Prophet the same conduct will be required toward the leaders of the community, according to their status
distractors: This verse discusses the creation of the universe
This verse talks about the stories of previous prophets
This verse explains the rules of inheritance

tafsirQuiz.question: What key concept does this verse highlight?
tafsirQuiz.correctAnswer: This is always true of those who are unable to accept the Truth whole-heartedly. Such people are apparently in consonance with everyone else but, in reality, they are loyal only to their own interests, despite having given assurances on oath of their being devotees of the Truth

tafsirQuiz.question: What consequence is described in this ayah?
tafsirQuiz.correctAnswer: But in the Hereafter, when he sees that the things on which he relied are of no avail on the day of judgement, he will be struck with horror. When a self-seeking man opposes the call for Truth, he thinks that he is thus making himself safe
distractors: This verse explains the rules of inheritance
This verse describes the characteristics of believers
This verse discusses the creation of the universe

tafsirQuiz.question: What does this verse warn or promise?
tafsirQuiz.correctAnswer: In this world success is for the believers (God’s party). They should have such a strong relationship with God that they receive spiritual light from Him
